lines.text: Describes any force causing circular motion
Space station rotation causes sensation of gravity

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we determine the centripetal force acting on an object in circular motion?

Enduring Understandings:
1. The [OBJ:expsec_h559:centripetal force] acting on an object can be calculated by multiplying the object's mass by its speed squared, divided by the radius.
2. [OBJ:pwsec_h560:Artificial gravity] is an example of centripetal force.
